title-group.article-title: An Error Estimate of the Least Squares Finite Element Method for the Stokes Problem in Three Dimensions

abstract.p: In this paper we are concerned with the Stokes problem in three dimensions (see recent works of the author and B. N. Jiang for the two-dimensional case). It is a linear system of four PDEs with velocity <tex-math>$\underline{u}$</tex-math> and pressure p as unknowns. With the additional variable <tex-math>$\underline{\omega} = \operatorname{curl} \underline{u}$</tex-math>, the second-order problem is reduced to a first-order system. Considering the compatibility condition <tex-math>$\operatorname{div} \underline{\omega} = 0$</tex-math>, we have a system with eight first-order equations and seven unknowns. A least squares method is applied to this extended system, and also to the corresponding boundary conditions. The analysis based on works of Agmon, Douglis, and Nirenberg; Wendland; Zienkiewicz, Owen, and Niles; etc. shows that this method is stable in the h-version. For instance, if we choose continuous piecewise polynomials to approximate <tex-math>$\underline{u}, \underline{\omega}$</tex-math>, and p, this method achieves optimal rates of convergence in the H<sup>1</sup>-norms.
